it.dc.bridge.om

Interface CoAPInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoAPResource

    @BusInterface(name="com.bridge.Coap",
              announced="true",
              descriptionLanguage="en",
              description="RESTful CoAP interface")
public interface CoAPInterface
    The CoAPInterface is an AllJoyn interface implemented by the AllJoyn objects representing a CoAP resource. It implements the following RESTful methods:
    • get(RequestMessage) the GET method.
    • post(RequestMessage) the POST method.
    • delete() the DELETE method.

    In addition to them, the interface implements the methods and the signal for the observing service:

    • registration(String, RequestMessage) registration to the resource observing service.
    • cancellation(String) cancellation from the resource observing service.
    • notification(ResponseMessage) signal that represents a resource notification.

    The signatures of the methods parameters reflect the attributes inside the RequestMessage and the ResponseMessage classes.

    See Also:
    CoAPRequestMessage, CoAPResponseMessage, RequestMessage, ResponseMessage

      The Endpoint Name ep attribute is an opaque string used by a device during its registration on the RD.
      java.lang.String getInterfaceDescription()
      The Interface Description if attribute is an opaque string used to provide a name or URI indicating a specific interface definition used to interact with the target resource.
      java.lang.String getResourceType()
      The Resource Type rt attribute is an opaque string used to assign an application-specific semantic type to a resource.
      void notification(ResponseMessage message)
      Notification is a signal sent by the AJ object when it receive a new notification from a CoAP resource.

      The POST method.

      The registration method is invoked by an AJ application that wants to registers to a resource notification.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        @BusMethod(name="get",
           signature="r",
           replySignature="r",
           description="Send a GET method call")
ResponseMessage get(RequestMessage request)
                                                                                                                                              throws org.alljoyn.bus.BusException
        The GET method. It executes a GET method on the RESTful CoAP interface of the resource represented by the AJ object that implements this interface.
        Parameters:
        request - the request message
        Returns:
        response the response message. If the request is fulfilled, the message contains 2.05 as response code.
        Throws:
        org.alljoyn.bus.BusException - AllJoyn bus exception

      • notification

        @BusSignal(name="notification",
           signature="r",
           description="A notification arrived")
void notification(ResponseMessage message)
                                                                                                                      throws org.alljoyn.bus.BusException
        Notification is a signal sent by the AJ object when it receive a new notification from a CoAP resource.
        Parameters:
        message - the notification message. Its payload contains the resource representation.
        Throws:
        org.alljoyn.bus.BusException - AllJoyn bus exception

        @BusProperty(name="getEndpoint",
             description="Returns the Endpoint name")
java.lang.String getEndpoint()
                                                                                                             throws org.alljoyn.bus.BusException
        The Endpoint Name ep attribute is an opaque string used by a device during its registration on the RD. It must be unique within the CoAP network.
        Returns:
        the Endpoint field
        Throws:
        org.alljoyn.bus.BusException - AllJoyn bus exception
